abstract.p: Lee Brown letter on Lisa Zeidner's September 10 article on adaptations of Henry James novels recalls Masterpiece Theater version of The Golden Bowl (S)

block.p: I am reminded of the virtues of the earlier BBC ''Masterpiece Theater'' version of ''The Golden Bowl.'' First, it gave us about four and a half visual hours of James's masterpiece. Second, it came close to solving the problem of what to do with the narrative voice, without resorting to a tedious voice-over. In the BBC version, that voice becomes a character, brilliantly played by Cyril Cusack. We see Cusack-as-storyteller sitting in his study, musing over the events he unfolds. The performance is a tour de force, since it manages to make complex Jamesian reflections seem conversational. Will the new film version offer as much?
